title: What was the number one song in September of 1973? - Quora

response.answer_text: The year 1973, was an eventful period in the timeline of history. The year had an inflation rate of 6.16%(USA) and 8.45% in the UK. A dozen eggs would cost you approximately 45 cents, a gallon of petrol 0.35 so forth and so on. Inflation had a significant impact on people living around the world. This causes the problem in every aspect of people lives from (as discussed ) price of gas to food and bills. The US in the year 1973 ends its involvement in the Vietnam war. And, indeed Paris Pease accords during the same year. Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs competed in the “the battle of the sexes” exhibition match during September. There was quite a number of songs produced during the same year but, finding the top song of September 1973 was quite easy. The Top Songs from September of 1973, are;- September 1 - “Brother Louie” By Stories - 100k ViewsSeptember 8 - “Let's Get It On” - Marvin Gaye - 74M ViewsSeptemeber 15 - “Delta Dawn” by Helen Reddy - 1.3M ViewsSeptember 29- “We’re an American Band” by Grand Funk - 2M views#1 is my favorite, thanks for taking me back to 1973.  In case, you are looking for a complete list of the songs produced in the years 1973 with a month wise statics then here it is. There is a lot to write about 1973, perhaps since it revolutionized many aspects of music, culture and daily lives of people. Additional Song in September of 1973;- "Loves Me Like a Rock""Here I Am (Come and Take Me)""Higher Ground""That Lady""Gypsy Man"Please let me know if you like my answer.
